poem:
Title: "Reverie in Print"

And so in this autumn of rebirth,
The Scotsman whispers of art,
Edinburgh to bloom in melody,
the world cradled in her heart.

On newspaper sheets, a shared vision unfolds,
nurturing the human spirit anew.
Across the sea of Europe,
they gather where the thistle grew.

The festival, a vibrant blossom,
unites us in its spectral hue.

It would host the first great postwar international art assembly in Europe, with a mission to celebrate the “flowering of the human spirit”.
